channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Prince William, Kate Middleton and their children lead Clap For Carers
item.description: Prince William, Kate Middleton, and their children put their hands together to praise everyone from NHS healthcare workers to shop assistants.

item.title: Charlene of Monaco, a road safety ambassador, calls for people to stay at home during the pandemic
item.description: Princess Charlene of Monaco has called for people to stay home during the coronavirus pandemic, in a video alongside Hollywood A-Listers.

item.title: Italy tested more than a million people for coronavirus as it sees fall in its daily cases to 2,646
item.description: As many as 40 per cent of new coronavirus cases in Italy were in the hard-hit Lombardy region where the first domestically transmitted case was confirmed just over two months ago.

item.title: Acapulco beach waves light up with bioluminescent plankton for the first time in over 60 years
item.description: Residents at beach in Acapulco, Mexico, were treated to a special light show when the shore was lit up with bioluminescent plankton Monday night for the first time in 60 years.

item.title: Kate Middleton wears blue floral Ghost dress to clap for the NHS at their Norfolk home
item.description: Kate put on a stylish display in a £129 Ghost floral blue dress as she joined Prince William, 37, Prince George, six, Princess Charlotte, four, and Prince Louis, two, to clap for the NHS tonight.

item.title: Traffic lights on toilet doors become the new normal in Italy
item.description: Workers flick a switch as they enter or leave the bathroom and the colour of the light tells those who want to enter if they can or have to wait.

item.title: BBC'S Big Night In: Dawn French RETURNS as the Vicar of Dibley
item.description: The star, 62, was back with her classic quick wit as she offered tips on how best to make use of your Easter eggs, getting to grips with Zoom and her exercise regime.

item.title: BBC Comic Relief Big Night In fundraising TV show gets underway
item.description: On the night Britain comes together to clap for the NHS, BBC One, Children in Need and Comic Relief are putting on a TV fundraiser to lift the nation's spirits.

item.title: The Weeknd backs Captain Tom Moore to reach the number one spot with NHS charity single
item.description: According to the latest sales and streaming data by the Official Charts Company, the musician's Blinding Lights is catching up to the 99-year-old veteran and Michael Ball's You'll Never Walk Alone.

item.title: Nuclear submarine commander investigated after crew hold BBQ and disco to welcome sailors home
item.description: Crew from the 'hunter-killer' sub HMS Trenchant held an impromptu party on the jetty alongside their boat at Devonport naval base after being at sea for two months.

item.title: Big Night In: Dua Lipa, Little Mix and Sam Smith lead musical performances
item.description: Award-winning singer Sam, 27, kicked off the performances from their £12million North London mansion with an emotional rendition of their hit single, Lay Me Down.

item.title: Wife had just 15 minutes to say goodbye to the man she had loved
item.description: Joanna Parker, from Romford, rushed to Queen's Hospital in east London to offer a heartbreaking final goodbye to her dying husband Keith Parker.

item.title: Study claims the value of lives saved by lockdowns outweighs economic damage by $5.2 TRILLION
item.description: The study assumes 2.2 million Americans would have been killed in the pandemic without lockdown measures, and that each life lost has a statistical value of $10 million.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Essential workers and families can be tested
item.description: Mr Hancock said any key workers whose children are still able to go to school will be eligible for the tests, including teachers, supermarket staff, lorry drivers and postal workers.

item.title: Tom Hanks sends his beloved vintage Corona typewriter to 'sad and angry' bullied boy named Corona
item.description: Corona De Vries, an eight-year-old from the Gold Coast in Australia, wrote to the Hollywood star after he and his wife, Rita, spent more than two weeks in quarantine after testing positive for coronavirus.

item.title: Matt Hancock refuses to set out how UK government will ease coronavirus lockdown
item.description: Health Secretary Matt Hancock today refused to bow to growing political pressure to set out how the UK government will ease the coronavirus lockdown.

item.title: Greenhouse gas emissions drop due to coronavirus lockdowns is NOT enough to stop climate change
item.description: The coronavirus has forced the world in a lockdown, resulting in a 6% drop in carbon dioxide levels, but experts warn it return to normal once the global economy recovers from the pandemic.

item.title: American billionaires have gotten $280BILLION richer since the start of the pandemic
item.description: Billionaires Jeff Bezos, Elon Musk, Eric Yuan and Steve Ballmer have added over a billion to their net worth as the coronavirus outbreak throws at least 26 million Americans out of work in five weeks.

item.title: A FIFTH of New York City residents tested positive for coronavirus antibodies in Cuomo's study
item.description: The study took samples from 3,000 randomly selected people across the state. Statewide, the virus prevalence was 13.9 percent but it was far higher in New York City, with 21.2 percent.

item.title: Baseball jersey for baby Archie and a pop-up book for the Queen among gifts given to the royals
item.description: The Duke and Duchess of Sussex were delighted to receive a New York Yankees jersey personalised for their son at the London Stadium in Stratford ahead of a match with the Red Sox.

item.title: Coronavirus victim's daughter slams NHS 111 service for not sending an ambulance for her father
item.description: Ali Kiraz Ozel, 66, passed away at home in Southend, Essex, in the early hours of April 10, after his family twice called NHS 111. His daughter, Sevtap Ahmet, 40, has made a complaint.

item.title: Coronavirus victim's daughter slams NHS 111 service for not sending an ambulance for her father
item.description: Ali Kiraz Ozel, 66, passed away at home in Southend, Essex, in the early hours of April 10, after his family twice called NHS 111. His daughter, Sevtap Ahmet, 40, has made a complaint.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Hottest day of the year so far during lockdown
item.description: Britons ignore lockdown rules on one of this year's hottest days and sunbathe at parks and on beaches instead of exercising despite sunbathing being against the UK's lockdown restrictions.

item.title: Gold-digging boyfriend ordered to pay back just £20 after stealing more than £24,000 from girlfriend
item.description: Andrew Baldry, 30, of Milford Haven, Pembrokeshire, siphoned the money from his girlfriend's bank account into his own, before using some of it to buy a car for himself.

item.title: Derby stars to withdraw offer to defer 25% of their wages as Wayne Rooney remains locked in talks
item.description: EXCLUSIVE BY SAMI MOKBEL: Sportsmail exclusively revealed how Rooney was acting on behalf of the squad in their battle against proposals to impose a 50 per cent wage deferral.

item.title: Land-based insect populations are in serious decline around the world
item.description: A team of scientists from around the world made their findings by by analysing 166 long-term surveys of insects from 1,676 sites worldwide.

item.title: Businessman who went bankrupt in high court battle with estranged wife after life fell apart
item.description: A businessman who nine years ago went bankrupt owing £33 million is now embroiled in a High Court fight over money with his estranged wife who insists he has more 'financial resources' than he claims.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Builders line up at construction sites
item.description: Builders are returning to construction sites and roads are visibly busier than a week ago, with traffic having increased to the highest levels since the lockdown was introduced a month ago.

item.title: NHS trusts buy their own antibody kits from Dutch firm to test staff
item.description: Hundreds of the Biozek tests have already been used on NHS staff in London, Manchester and Leicester as hospitals face a surge in demand at a time when up to a fifth of the workforce are off sick.

item.title: Harry Dunn death: RAF base probes crash as SECOND American accused of driving on wrong side
item.description: The Harry Dunn family have called for RAF Croughton to launch a probe after claiming images of a crash involving a staff member in Aynho, Northamptonshire, emerged last night.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Death toll hits 18,738 with 616 new fatalities
item.description: Today's statistics come as deep rifts are emerging in Government over when and how the UK will move out of its current lockdown state as the coronavirus infection rate starts to fall.

item.title: 'Weekend working and staggered shifts to avoid rush-hour crush when coronavirus lockdown is lifted
item.description: The current lockdown is due to run until May 7 and there are ever-stronger calls from some businesses and politicians to get the economy fired up as soon as possible.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Matt Hancock praises Muslims over lockdown
item.description: Communal prayers and Iftar, a meal eaten after sunset to break the daylight fast, are key parts of the holy month. The Health Secretary acknowledged the hardship this will mean.

item.title: Africa's 43% jump in virus cases in one week as WHO warn continent could become the next epicentre
item.description: African governments reported a total of nearly 26,000 cases as of today, according to the Africa Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. That figure is up from just over 16,000 a week ago.

item.title: Ibiza could open up for holidays in August - but Britons told to stay away due to 'delayed' lockdown
item.description: Ibiza, Majorca, Menorca and Fromentera will not welcome Britons this summer because the UK 'took too long' to bring in its coronavirus lockdown, said Balearics Tourism minister Iago Negueruela.

item.title: Ex Vogue editor Andre Leon Talley rips into Anna Wintour, revealing how their friendship ended
item.description: Former Vogue editor Andew Leon Talley writes he has 'huge emotional and psychological scars' from his decades long friendship with Anna Wintour, Vogue's notoriously icy editor.

item.title: New mother, 29, dies from coronavirus in hospital without being able to cuddle her son
item.description: Fozia Hanif, 29, passed away in Birmingham Heartlands Hospital from coronavirus after her ventilator was turned off on April 8. She gave birth to her son via caesarean section on April 2.

item.title: Thousands of flamingos travel to Indian lake after coronavirus lockdown causes cleaner air and water
item.description: As many as 150,000 flamingos have migrated to wetlands in a Mumbai suburb. As India remains under a nationwide lockdown, lower pollution levels have been cited for the increased number.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Vital operations cancelled despite empty beds
item.description: Figures suggest that up to four times the number of beds are free than normal while Nightingale hospitals (pictured, at London's Excel) and private hospitals also lie empty.

item.title: Area around Cheltenham Racecourse shows Covid-19 spike
item.description: Two postcodes near Cheltenham Racecourse have reported almost a quarter of all Covid-19 hospital admissions in Gloucestershire, new leaked data has revealed.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Two thirds say journalists are NOT doing a good job of questioning ministers
item.description: BBC Newsnight host Emily Maitlis's comments emerged as a poll found more than two thirds of people think journalists have not done a good job of holding Ministers to account.

item.title: Wodaabe tribe where MEN spend hours doing their hair and makeup to impress women
item.description: The Wodaabe tribe are often known as the vaniest in Africa because of how their culture prizes beauty - but it is the men who are expected to make the effort, especially during the annual Gerewol festival.

item.title: Super-rare 1,000-year-old 1p coin depicting child king of Saxon Britain sells for £11,000
item.description: The ancient silver coin showed the face of Edward the Martyr who ruled Saxon Britain in the 10th Century, aged 13, before he was assassinated three years later.

item.title: Man with dementia from Stevenage gets threatening note slamming him for not clapping for NHS
item.description: Gerald Rex, 90, lives alone in Stevenage after his wife of 70 years Barbara died in a care home. In recent weeks he got a note through his letterbox branding him a 'hypocrite'.

item.title: Experimental cancer drug may stop coronavirus by blocking the virus from copying itself
item.description: The University of Louisville has developed a synthetic DNA piece called 'aptamer' that binds a protein called nucleolin found on the surface of cells and stops diseases from replicating themselves.

item.title: Millionaire Castaway David Glasheen reveals his top tips for living in isolation
item.description: David Glasheen, 76, has been living on Restoration Island off the coast of north Australia since 1997 after losing his wealth. He hunts for food and goes grocery shopping once a year in Cairns.

item.title: Spotify unveils new feature that will let users pay musicians directly
item.description: Spotify has launched a new feature that will allow subscribers to donate money directly to their favorite artists through the app, part of the company's efforts to help musicians during COVID-19.

item.title: Bird-brained: Parrots and crows have evolved 'truly exceptional' brain sizes
item.description: A team of 37 international researchers made the discovery after tracing the history of brain evolution of terrestrial animals for millions of years.
item.media:credit: COURTESY OF WITMERLAB AT OHIO UNIVERSITY

item.title: Ex-soldier who was jailed for life for trying to murder his retired neighbours dies of coronavirus
item.description: Sean Hedley Tierney, 74, had been serving 15 years as a prisoner at HMP Altcourse following a crazed 2012 attack on a couple from Llandudno in north Wales.

item.title: Jersey will be the first British isle to ban smacking children
item.description: Jersey's amendment banning corporal punishment passed through the States Assembly by 39 votes to four. Jersey will start enforcing the ban tomorrow.

item.title: Coronavirus: Scotland drug trials to treat respiratory damage
item.description: Researchers from the University of Dundee will conduct trials of brensocatib - formerly known as INS1007 - to tackle lung inflammation caused by the virus.

item.title: Singer wows with an impromptu performance in hospital car park
item.description: Michael MacDonald, 30, spent three hours outside Churchill Hospital in Oxford as coronavirus restrictions mean he was unable to go inside to comfort his friend, Steve Vincent, 26.

item.title: Seven people are hurt with one seriously injured in mass brawl at a traveller site in Chichester
item.description: At least seven people were injured in the fight at the site near Chichester in West Sussex, police believe. An air ambulance was called after reports that a fight broke out at 9.40am this morning.

item.title: Lockdown punch-up! Stunt school students trade blows in an ingenious coronavirus challenge video
item.description: Students from the stunt double school Campus Univers Cascades in northern France made a clever video of students punching or kicking each other in an elaborate chain of staged violence.

item.title: Thieves who steal manhole covers will face the DEATH PENALTY in China
item.description: Pictured: A maintenance worker peers into a manhole cover in China to speak to his colleague. Anyone caught stealing or a manhole cover in China can now be charged with the death penalty.

item.title: Ethnic minority medics account for 72 per cent of all NHS Covid-19 deaths
item.description: Mr Manjeet Singh Riyat, pictured, was the first Sikh to be appointed an Emergency Consultant in a British hospital. Mr Riyat worked at the Royal Derby Hospital who praised his dedication and hard work.

item.title: Seal pup attacks conservationists's net as they remove fishing line tangled round its mother's neck
item.description: A seal pup in Namibia tries to defend its mother by biting an Ocean Conservation Namibia worker's net. Footage shows the workers saving the seal from nylon string wrapped around her neck.

item.title: Wuhan laboratory scientists 'did absolutely crazy things' to alter coronavirus
item.description: World renowned expert Professor Petr Chumakov claimed their aim was to study the pathogenicity of the virus and not 'with malicious intent' to deliberately create a manmade killer.

item.title: Crazed knifeman stabs policeman in stomach then sets his house on fire
item.description: A police officer is in hospital after he was stabbed by a crazed knifeman this morning, who then set fire to a house in Newport, Wales this morning.

item.title: Coronavirus is killing its victims up to 13 YEARS before they would have died naturally, study finds
item.description: Men who die of COVID-19 are losing, on average, 13 years of their lives, while women have 11 years cut off their life expectancy, according to a study carried out by Public Health Scotland.

item.title: Remarkable black and white snaps of the Rolling Stones in 1963 go on sale for £1,500
item.description: Some brilliant photographs of the Rolling Stones looking clean cut before they hit the big time are going on sale. The collection of black and white images is available for £1,500.

item.title: Coronavirus Germany: Angela Merkel fears early lockdown ease
item.description: Germany has begun reopening schools and non-essential shops while Spain has announced children will be allowed out of the house as lockdowns ease, as their leaders urged caution.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: £200k-a-year civil servant behind PPE shambles
item.description: Jin Sahota, 52, is the £200,000-a-year chief executive of Supply Chain Co-ordination Limited (SCCL) which is the management arm of the NHS supply operation.

item.title: Coronavirus Europe: Nearly half of deaths were in care homes
item.description: The WHO's European director Hans Kluge revealed the staggering figure at a press conference today where he labelled the deaths an 'unimaginable human tragedy'.

item.title: Walsall grandmother, 68, died after oxygen tank set armchair alight and caused explosion in her home
item.description: Walsall grandmother Lynn Hadley, 68, died after sparks from an oxygen tank being used to treat her for suspected coronavirus set fire to an arm chair and exploded, an inquest has heard.

item.title: Minister refuses to apologise for lack of PPE saying UK 'not alone' in struggling to protect medics
item.description: Lord Bethell said Britain was 'not alone in struggling' with the amount of gowns, gloves and masks required and no one could have anticipated the 'huge demands' placed on supplies.

item.title: Single care home where 11 out of Isle of Man's 15 coronavirus deaths has its licence suspended
item.description: Abbotswood Nursing Home in Ballasalla, Isle of Man had its license suspended on April 13 after nearly 40 residents tested positive for coronavirus.

item.title: Employment tribunal dismisses tech executive's sexism claims after boss said she 'has balls'
item.description: Rachel Power, was working at cyber security start-up Secure Code Warrior in Northampton in 2018 when she got into a dispute with chief executive Pieter Danhieux.

item.title: Covidiot 'tries to run over' swan in a speedboat and circles around the distressed bird
item.description: Olivia Satchwell, 18, filmed a speedboat driver repeatedly circling around a swan at a boating lake in Little Paxton, Cambridgeshire. She believes the driver was trying to run it over.

item.title: Champions League qualification will be decided on sporting merit if season can't be finished
item.description: The decision would secure a Champions League spot next season for the Premier League's current top four of Liverpool, City, Leicester and Chelsea, with United, Tottenham and Arsenal missing out.

item.title: Coronavirus China: City of 10m 'on lockdown' after new outbreak
item.description: More than 70 people have been infected and over 4,000 are being tested in Harbin, north-eastern China, after the virus was believed to be 'imported' by a student who had returned from the US.

item.title: Coronavirus survivor told by doctors practising deep breathing methods saved him from a ventilator
item.description: A man who was hospitalised with coronavirus but has since overcome it, believes he may have done so due to practising deep breathing exercises.

item.title: Coronavirus: China's ambassador to UK rejects claims of cover up
item.description: China's ambassador to the UK has insisted Beijing did not cover up the scale of its coronavirus outbreak as he warned the US the communist state will not be 'bullied'.

item.title: Nurse wakes up from coma to find his partner has died of coronavirus while his colleague also dies
item.description: David Courtney-Williams, a nurse, woke up at Morriston Hospital near Swansea to the news his partner, Steven, alongside his colleague Sharon Bamford and her husband had died from coronavirus.

item.title: Pet owner puts his dog on the top of his car without harness while driving through city centre
item.description: CCTV footage shows the black dog standing on the top of its owner's moving car without any protection in China. The driver claimed that there was not enough room in the car for his pet.

item.title: Dominic Cummings lifts the lid on isolation with wife and young son when he was ill with coronavirus
item.description: Journalist Mary Wakefield revealed that Mr Cummings, 48, spent 10 days bedridden with the disease after coming home to nurse her through a milder case.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Vaccine trial volunteers reveal side effects
item.description: One of the first Brits to sign up for the coronavirus vaccination scheme has spoken about what he expects to happen. Simeon Courties, speaking from Oxfordshire, is taking part in the trial that starts today.

item.title: Lock-down and dirty! Amorous couple are caught on camera having sex on Brighton beach at 7.50am
item.description: A couple were spotted having sex in broad daylight on Brighton beach on Thursday morning. The onlookers found the scene hilarious but their presence did not put the couple off.

item.title: Knife crime soars by 7% to highest ever level with 45,627 offences in England and Wales in 2019
item.description: The number of recorded knife crimes in England and Wales has soared by 7 per cent to its highest ever level, with a third of all recorded offences taking place in London, according to the ONS.

item.title: Prince Charles warned about environmental impact luxury wedding venue at his Scottish stately home
item.description: Prince Charles has been warned of the environmental impact of building a luxury wedding venue in the grounds of his Scottish stately home - a day after he urged others to protect the planet.

item.title: Twitter acts against `unverified claims´ inciting 5G
item.description: The social network said it is taking action to prevent misinformation about the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Scientists identify the cells in human lungs, nose and intestines most vulnerable to COVID-19
item.description: An international team of experts used a database of which genes are turned on by which cells to identify the cell types which produce the two proteins COVID-19 uses to enter and infect cells.

item.title: Egyptian Instagram influencer is arrested for 'inciting debauchery'
item.description: TikTok and Instagram influencer Haneen Hossam was reportedly arrested on the morning of April 21 after her online video sparked outrage in Egypt.

item.title: Eurozone economy is suffering 'unprecedented' collapse
item.description: The purchasing managers' index (PMI) released by analysis firm IHS Markit showed the 'steepest falls in business activity and employment ever recorded' during April in the 19 eurozone nations.

item.title: Coronavirus Sweden: Cases grow slowly despite lack of lockdown
item.description: Over the last three days, Sweden added an average of 53 cases per million people, whereas Britain's figure was 66 despite a shutdown which has now been in place for a month.

item.title: Lockdown with the Forte family: Hotel boss Sir Rocco and his daughters in isolation
item.description: Sir Rocco Forte and his wife Aliai are in lockdown at Ryde Farm in Ripley, Surrey, with daughters Lydia and Irene, son Charles, their respective partners, and Lydia's 14-month-old son, Johnny.

item.title: SpaceX is 'fixing' the brightness of its Starlink satellites
item.description: Elon Musk is 'fixing' the issue of SpaceX satellites disrupting the night sky for stargazers. Brits have been left confused by the Starlink satellites - the latest batch of which launched yesterday.

item.title: Russia reports fall in coronavirus cases amid claims it is not being transparent
item.description: Russia reported 4,774 new cases of coronavirus Thursday - marking the second straight day of decline - despite warnings that the country is rapidly running out of hospital beds.

item.title: Diary found that tells of Bletchley park's codebreaker's romance with German woman
item.description: Becky Edmunds found 12 diaries on a pile of rubbish in Brighton that uncover the romance story of an Enigma team codebreaker and a German woman torn between her love and her Nazi-loyalist sons.

item.title: Kate Middleton dressed Prince Louis in a £12 Tu check bodysuit
item.description: The Duchess of Cambridge opted to dress Prince Louis in a £12 Tu check bodysuit from Sainsbury's to take the adorable pictures released for the royal's 2nd birthday today.

item.title: Sue Martin says husband Mal has had tracheotomy but isn't strong enough to be weaned off ventilator
item.description: Sue Martin, 49, from Cardiff, tweeted to say her husband Mal, 58, underwent a tracheotomy yesterday to make him more comfortable and lessen his sedation.

item.title: Mansion where Roxy Music and Pink Floyd recorded hits on the market for £6m
item.description: St Ann's Court, near Chertsey in Surrey, was where Roxy Music and members of Pink Floyd, The Jam and Soft Machine recorded many of their hits.

item.title: Public can vote for their favourite New Big Five animals to photograph
item.description: The project has been launched by UK-based photographer Graeme Green. It is supported by other renowned wildlife photographers, who have revealed some of their favourite shots.

item.title: Britain's Deputy Chief Medical Officer believes she had coronavirus
item.description: Speaking to Lorraine Kelly this morning on Good Morning Britain Dr Jenny Harries said she had coronavirus and that it had been an 'unpleasant experience'.

item.title: French researchers plan to give nicotine patches to coronavirus patients and frontline workers
item.description: The moves comes after a new study from Paris, France, found that few people hospitalized, or at home, with coronavirus were regular smokers compared to the general population.

item.title: Princess Beatrice makes her first appearance since cancelling wedding
item.description: Princess Beatrice, 31, opened up about the 'incredibly challenging time' facing the UK and the world in her first public appearance since postponing her May wedding.

item.title: Trump has coronavirus briefing tantrum over CDC boss' warning of 'even more difficult' second wave
item.description: President Donald Trump raged about media coverage of CDC Director Robert Redfield's warning about a second wave of the coronavirus.

item.title: Scientists discover 19 interstellar asteroids between Jupiter and Neptune
item.description: French astronomers believe the space rocks were ripped from their original location as the universe expanded and the sun was growing.

item.title: Father is stunned to discover motorbike from the 1960s BURIED a metre beneath the flowerbed
item.description: Chris Hopkins, 51, a council housing officer from Bromsgrove, Worcestershire, had been digging for weed free soil when he stumbled across the almost entirely intact bike one metre down.

item.title: Scientists create the first geological map of the lunar surface
item.description: The lunar map, called the Unified Geologic Map of the Moon, has been created by the United States Geological Survey (USGS), NASA and the Lunar Planetary Institute.

item.title: Bin Laden wanted to kill Obama because he thought Joe Biden was totally unprepared to be president
item.description: Declassified documents seized from Bin Laden's Pakistan compound as he was killed in May 2011 reveal his plans to throw the U.S. 'into a crisis' by killing Obama and leaving Joe Biden in charge.

item.title: Playful Prince! Kensington Palace release a snap of a VERY messy Louis
item.description: Prince Louis, who is celebrating his 2nd birthday today, can be seen beaming in the new picture, which was released on the Kensington Palace Twitter today.

item.title: Prince Charles wishes Prince Louis a happy second birthday
item.description: Prince Charles has released an unseen photo with Prince Louis to mark his grandson's second birthday today.

item.title: Italian prosecutors are considering criminal trials for health officials
item.description: More than 45,000 people have joined NOI Denunceremo - meaning We will report - which is a Facebook group where testimonies are being gathered for magistrates.

item.title: Fly-tipping ground has so much rubbish it can be seen from space
item.description: The site is piled high with household items with hundreds of car tyres, piles of clothes, suitcases and doors scattered across the disused road off the M4 in Newport, south Wales.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Ryanair says planes will NOT fly with empty middle seat
item.description: Ryanair chief executive Michael O'Leary claimed proposals to force planes to fly under capacity when the coronavirus travel restrictions end were 'mad,' unaffordable and 'hopelessly ineffective'.

item.title: Britain's economy sinks into deep-freeze as output plummets
item.description: The closely-watched Markit/CIPS Flash UK Composite Purchasing Managers' Index fell to a new record low of 12.9 - down precipitously from an already low reading 36 in March.

item.title: Teenager is charged with rape and sexual offences at Jack and Jill nursery in Devon
item.description: A teenage boy, 17, has been charged with rape and sexual offences against at least eight children at a nursery in Devon.

item.title: Mother reveals her husband's asked for an open marriage so he can have sex with other women
item.description: The British woman, 30, who did not give her name, explained on Mumsnet that her husband wants to rent out a second flat where he can stay and see his 'girlfriends' during the working week.

item.title: Best-selling author and foster mother Cathy Glass says she never gets over sexual abuse cases
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Best-selling author Cathy Glass, whose fostering memoirs have sold more than 4.5 million copies worldwide, told Femail she's often the first person a child will tell about sexual abuse.

item.title: These inexpensive features costing less than £100 can add up to £50,000 to the value of your home
item.description: UK-based online tools seller My Tool Shed has revealed its top tips on how to increase your home's value, costing just £765 in total to do - and they can add £50,000 to the value of your house.

item.title: North Korean defector 'tests positive for coronavirus' after crossing into China
item.description: The North Korean man was rushed to hospital after being shot by a Chinese border guard while trying to defect on April 20 where he tested positive for coronavirus, a source has said.

item.title: Saudi human rights activist warned to expect 'the same fate that happened to Jamal Khashoggi'
item.description: Alya Abutayah Alhwaiti claims she received death threats on the phone and on Twitter from people she believes are supporters of Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman. Pictured is the planned city Neom.

item.title: Tory MPs' fury at coronavirus lockdown limbo
item.description: Furious Tory MPs have warned the government it must spell out in detail how it intends to ease the UK's coronavirus lockdown to give businesses hope of survival.

item.title: Drunk father who battered his ex-wife in front of their daughter is jailed
item.description: Mohammed Osman, 37, left his ex-wife with a fractured jaw when she tried to go home with their daughter because he was drinking heavily on a Boxing Day family trip in Didsbury, Manchester.

item.title: Savvy mum invents genius challenge to each kids how to meal prep
item.description: Sarah Chick, 32, from Dorset, has a genius challenge to teach her children how to meal prep during lockdown. The mum-of five and stepmum of one

item.title: We try before you buy: CLAIRE COLEMAN tests the best brow-defining pens
item.description: Claire Coleman gives her verdict on a selection of the best brow-defining pens. The British beauty expert was most impressed with Lottie London Arch Rival and GOSH brow hair.

item.title: Photographer uses Zoom and FaceTime to capture images of people at home
item.description: Mikaël Theimer, who was born in Paris and now lives in Montreal, Canada, used Zoom, FaceTime and Facebook messenger to snap shots of people in their opulent homes amid the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: What to wear this weekend: FEMAIL picks out the best neon brights for effortless style this season
item.description: Dinah Van Tulleken shares advice for embracing this season's neon brights trend. The British style expert also reveals a selection of the best pieces available from online retailers.

item.title: Can YOU name these well-known phrases?
item.description: Nikki Spiers, 31, of London, unwittingly became an international sensation last month when the cryptic emoji quiz she sent to a group of friends via WhatsApp was shared around the world.

item.title: How series three of BBC thriller Killing Eve came to life in some VERY ordinary West London streets
item.description: Fans of the BBC hit drama Killing Eve have been thrilled to spot so many filming locations they recognise from suburban London neighbourhoods in the programme.

item.title: Single mother reveals how she transformed her kitchen from drab to fabulous
item.description: Victoria Robinson, 33, a part time Tesco worker from Hertfordshire, took to a Facebook group to share how she turned her drab kitchen into a modern space by swapping her handles and tiles.

item.title: EuroMillions winner who scooped £58m plans to build his own home
item.description: Self-employed joiner Ryan Hoyle, 38, of Rochdale, Greater Manchester, whose mother works as a school cleaner and father works in a factory, won £58,366,487 in a EuroMillions jackpot.

item.title: JANE FRYER recalls the man who revolutionised the entertainment industry
item.description: JANE FRYER: By the time he was 23, Ronan O'Rahilly had fled his native Ireland for London, was running a successful club in Soho, The Scene and set up a record label.

item.title: SpaceX launches its Falcon 9 carrying 60 new Starlink satellites and marking its 84th flight
item.description: SpaceX hit a milestone today after launching its Falcon 9 carrying a new batch of 60 Starlinks satellites. This is its 84th mission, which more than another currently operational US rocket.

item.title: The violent rampage of Diane Abbott's diplomat son James Abbott-Thompson
item.description: The terrified MP called police begging for help when James Abbott-Thompson began chasing her round her house with the scissors while claiming he had a gun in his dressing gown.

item.title: Crane comeback continues as population reaches 400-year high
item.description: Conservation work and reintroductions have helped boost the UK´s tallest bird, which went extinct here in the 1600s.
item.media:description: Common cranes have made a return to the UK (Andy Hay/RSPB/PA)

item.title: Woman reveals we've all been sealing cereal boxes wrong
item.description: British TikTok user Katy Bee left followers amazed when she revealed that you've probably been closing cereal boxes all wrong, and shared her trick for doing it the right way.
